oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1945-06-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1945-06-17 at 5:00 pm, part 1. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Lionel Ricau (announcer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer) including Harold Johnson (violin), Danny Ryan (performer), Kay Carlisle (performer), and the Old Timers Quartet (performers). This recording starts with the end of the previous show, the General Motors Symphony Of The Air, with Dr Frank Black and the NBC Symphony Orchestra, and announcer Ben Grauer.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Beasley Smith; Lion Orchestra; Danny Ryan; Kay Carlisle; Harold Johnson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: General Motors commercial (Ben Grauer) -- General Motors Symphony program closing statement (Ben Grauer) -- Bulova Watch commercial -- Theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Mimi (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Danny Ryan -- Did I Remember (Danny Ryan) -- Louie Buck introduces Lionel Ricau -- Lion Oil commercial (Lionel Ricau) -- Louie Buck introduces the next piece -- Cherry (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Kay Carlisle -- You Made Me Love You (I Didn't Want to Do It) (Kay Carlisle) -- Louie Buck introduces Harold Johnson -- The World Is Mine Tonight (Harold Johnson violin) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: National Broadcasting Company; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); Bulova (Firm); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Ricau, Lionel; Smith, Beasley; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Ryan, Danny (Vocalist); Carlisle, Kay (Vocalist); Johnson, Harold (Musician); Old Timers Quartet
